layout_algorithm
Class CircleLayout

java.lang.Object
  layout_algorithm.CircleLayout

public class CircleLayout
extends java.lang.Object

please refer to the article, "crossing reduction in circular layouts*", edited by M. Baur and U. Brandes.

Method Summary
protected  void CircularSifting()
          running the sifting: for each node in the current graph, it will be the number of crossing at every position in the circle, finally its position will changed to the one with the minimal crossing.

Constructor Detail

CircleLayout

public CircleLayout(java.util.HashMap transitionMap,
                    java.util.HashMap stateMap,
                    JGraphController jgc)
initialize these data structures

Parameters:
transitionMap - store nodes which are connected by a node
stateMap - store the ID of the node in the graph
jgc - jgraph controller
Method Detail

RunLayout

public void RunLayout()
the main procedure to control running the circular layout

CircularSifting

protected void CircularSifting()
running the sifting: for each node in the current graph, it will be the number of crossing at every position in the circle, finally its position will changed to the one with the minimal crossing.

ExchangeNodes

protected void ExchangeNodes(CircleLayout.Node u,
                             CircleLayout.Node v)
exchange two nodes' id in the layoutNodeIDs.

Parameters:
u - a node
v - a node

LetWfollowU

protected void LetWfollowU(CircleLayout.Node u,
                           CircleLayout.Node w)
let nodw w follow u, and change positions of all nodes

Parameters:
u - a node
v - a node

IsCrossing

protected int IsCrossing(CircleLayout.Node x,
                         CircleLayout.Node y,
                         CircleLayout.Node u,
                         CircleLayout.Node v)
Parameters:
u - a node
v - a node
x - u's neighbor. a neighbor is a node which is connected by a edge.
y - v's neighbor. a neighbor is a node which is connected by a edge.
Returns:
to decide if there is a crossing between the edge of x and u and the edge of y and v. return 1 indicating yes, 0 indicating no

CountCrossingsWhenNodeAtRightEnd

protected int CountCrossingsWhenNodeAtRightEnd(CircleLayout.Node node,
                                               int rPos)
Parameters:
node - a node
rPos - the right position of node
Returns:
the number of crossing when the node is placed at the right end

                                              int lPos)
Parameters:
node - a node
lPos - the left position of node
Returns:
the number of crossing when the node is placed at the left end

GetNodeIDWithLeastUnPlacedNeighbor

protected int GetNodeIDWithLeastUnPlacedNeighbor()
Returns:
the id of node which has the least number of unplaced neighbors

InitialData

set availableNodeIDs, nodeMap with nodes of the current graph

GetConnectedNodes
